meanings.sent1: She wrings the wet cloth to remove excess water.
meanings.sent2: He always wrings his hands when he is nervous.
meanings.sent3: The cat wrings the toy mouse in its paws playfully.
meanings.sent4: The storm wrings the tree branches, making them sway violently.
meanings.sent5: The wrestler wrings his opponent's arm to gain the upper hand.

meanings.sent1: She wrings a confession out of the suspect after hours of questioning.
meanings.sent2: He wrings every last drop of information from the old books.
meanings.sent3: The detective wrings the truth from the unreliable witness.
meanings.sent4: The explorer wrings valuable knowledge from the ancient scrolls.
meanings.sent5: The student wrings a passing grade from the challenging exam.

meanings.definition: Cause mental or emotional distress to (someone).
meanings.sent1: The heartbreaking news wrings tears from her eyes.
meanings.sent2: The thought of losing her pet wrings her heart with sorrow.
meanings.sent3: The scary movie wrings screams from the audience.
meanings.sent4: The tragic ending of the play wrings emotions from the viewers.
meanings.sent5: The cruel words wrings pain from his soul.
